authors.headline: Senior Legal Counsel and Special Adviser to the Executive Director at the Wildlife Justice Commission

profile_positions.description:
•	The mission of the Wildlife Justice Commission (WJC) is to disrupt and help dismantle the criminal networks that profit from the trafficking of wildlife, timber, and fish—crimes that bring species to extinction and put global security and public health at risk

•	As Senior Legal Counsel: Provide substantive and procedural legal advice to the Executive Director and other members of WJC team; provide legal advice on the operational aspects of WJC’s intelligence-led investigations; draft/review all manner of legal agreements and commercial contracts; advise on legislation and regulations both inside and outside of the Netherlands; advise on employment law matters; draft/review internal regulations and policies; advise on governance matters, which can be complex and require knowledge of the law of different jurisdictions; and supervise Legal Counsel

•	As Special Adviser: Provide strategic and policy advice to the Executive Director on a wide-range of issues confronting the WJC; manage the Executive Office on a day-to-day basis and liaise with the Management Team and the Committees and Boards of the WJC; handle the oversight of special projects that do not neatly fit within the organisational chart or that fall between departments or leadership areas of responsibility; and stand-in for the Executive Director at internal and external events
profile_positions.title: Senior Legal Counsel and Special Adviser to the Executive Director

profile_positions.location: Centre of Energy Law and Sustainability (GCELS)
profile_positions.description:
•	Provide legal analysis and support to the InterOPERA Project, specifically researching, negotiating, and drafting a multi-party cooperation framework

•	The purpose of the Project, which is funded by the EU programme for research and innovation, is to bring together a diverse set of stakeholders from the renewable energy industry to develop multi-vendor high-voltage direct current electricity grids in order to transition Europe to sustainable energy at large scale. The Project will set future legal and technical interoperability standards for these grids, which will enhance offshore wind development and integration

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
•	Provided high-level, complex strategic and legal advice on the multinational operations to dismantle the Syrian chemical weapons programme (2014–2015), remove the remainder of the chemical weapons from Libya (2015–2016), destroy the remnants of Iraq’s chemical weapons programme (2017), and destroy old chemical weapons in Panama (2017)—while ensuring that all these operations were conducted in accordance with national and international environmental standards

•	Robustly defend the OPCW from suits brought against it, with a consistent track record of eliminating or significantly reducing the ultimate liability of the Organisation
profile_positions.title: Principal Legal Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	As a Team Leader and Legal Officer, led teams of international lawyers in conducting the trials of political and military leaders for serious breaches of international humanitarian law in the Slobodan Milošević, Milan Milutinović et al., Stanišić and Župljanin, and Hadžić trials

•	As Deputy Chef de Cabinet and Acting Chef de Cabinet in the Office of the President, provided diplomatic, budgetary, and legal advice to the President of the Tribunal, including during meetings of the United Nations Security Council and in relation to the enforcement of sentences of convicted persons, appeals from the Yugoslavia and Rwanda Tribunals, and budgetary matters

•	As the Head of the Rules Committee, analyzed and recommended several amendments to the Judicial Rules of Procedure and Evidence, including changes to enable the Tribunal to share information with domestic prosecutors
